title: Diabetes – Complications and Management by Dr. Rajendiran N, Senior Consultant, MBBS, MD
body: Dr. Rajendiran N is one of the best endocrinologists in India and has over 41 years of experience. At present, Dr. Rajendiran is working as a Senior Diabetes Consultant at Apollo Hospital, Greams Road, Chennai. He specializes in Type 1 Diabetes and Type 2 Diabetes, Gestational Diabetes, Diabetes Management, Filaria Treatment, Irritable Bowel Syndrome Treatment, Insulin Free Treatment, and Diabetic Neuropathy After completing his MBBS and MD (Internal Medicine) from Madras University, Dr. Rajendiran N continued his work in the area of diabetes and its management. He was the Founder President of Madras Medical College Diabetes Alumni Association. He is the Secretary of the Diabetes Association of India (Southern Chapter).

title: Parents of Apparently Normal child Sophia Ramkhalawan were Jolted Back to Know that she Needed Open Heart Surgery; Decided to Visit India
body: Sophia is a 3 years old girl from Trinidad and Tobago. She was born on 19th February 2016. While doing her complete health checkup, the doctor diagnosed that she has an atrial septal defect. Although she did not have any signs and symptoms related to the condition, the doctor recommended that she would need open-heart surgery. The parents did not want to take any risks with her life. To obtain the best treatment for Sophia, the couple decided to visit India for the surgery.

title: Dr. Raghunath’s Role in Trauma Surgery and Why General Surgeons Are so Important for Us?
body: General surgeons play a key role in A&E departments where trauma surgery is needed. In rural regions, general surgeons are in great demand for their extensive array of skills. Their vital responsibilities include examine patients, diagnose to ascertain the requirement for surgery, review the patient medical record and schedule the best process for treatment, surgery risk evaluation and advice provided to the patients, prescribe preoperative and postoperative treatment and measures, plan and implement disease/illness prevention and health promotion programs etc.
